name: Virtual Machines & Compute Services
description: Virtualization and compute services are fundamental to cloud engineering, enabling scalable and flexible infrastructure. In this topic, you will focus on deploying virtual machines on various cloud providers (such as AWS, Azure, and GCP).

learning_steps.title: What are Compute Services?
learning_steps.description: Learn the fundamentals of cloud compute - the on-demand delivery of computing power that forms the foundation of cloud infrastructure.

learning_steps.title: Understanding Virtualization
learning_steps.description: Understand how virtualization technology enables running multiple virtual machines on a single physical server, enabling cloud scalability.

Learn to choose the right VM specs (CPU, RAM, storage) based on workload requirements. Different instance types are optimized for:

• General purpose - balanced compute, memory, networking
• Compute optimized - CPU-intensive workloads
• Memory optimized - large datasets in memory
• Storage optimized - high sequential read/write

learning_steps.text: Hands-on: Deploy a VM using default configuration
learning_steps.description: Deploy a Virtual Machine on any cloud provider using the default configuration. Don't worry about custom networking or security groups yet - just get comfortable with the deployment process and verify your VM is running and accessible.

questions.prompt: Walk me through what virtualization is and how it enables cloud computing at scale.
scenario_seeds: Your manager asks you to explain to the finance team why the company can run 50 different applications on just 10 physical servers in the data center.
A junior developer is confused about why they can spin up a new server in minutes when it used to take weeks to procure hardware.
During a capacity planning meeting, someone asks how cloud providers can offer seemingly unlimited compute resources.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain the hypervisor's role in abstracting hardware AND describe how multiple VMs share physical resources AND address the benefits of isolation between workloads.

questions.prompt: How would you approach choosing a VM instance type for a new workload? What factors matter most?
scenario_seeds: Your team is deploying a machine learning training job that processes large datasets entirely in memory and needs to complete within 4 hours.
A web application team asks you to recommend an instance type for their Node.js API that handles 10,000 concurrent users.
The data team wants to run a batch job that reads and writes terabytes of data from attached storage every night.
questions.grading_rubric: Must identify key resource dimensions (CPU, memory, storage, network) AND explain how workload characteristics map to instance families AND address cost considerations in the decision.

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you explain what Compute Services are and why they are important in cloud computing?
Can you describe how virtualization works and its role in cloud infrastructure?
Can you quiz me on the difference between Virtualization and Compute Services?
Can you compare the compute services provided by AWS, Azure, and GCP?
Can you explain what a hypervisor is, how it works, and why it is essential for virtualization?
